How will pension reforms affect the wider economy? Macroeconomic implications may vary depending on the measure. For example, increasing the retirement age stimulates labour supply and consumption. Other measures might be less effective on this front. 6/6 https://t.co/4efkcQtpIk

What can be done to address the challenges posed by population ageing?  Euro area countries should use today’s improved economic environment to implement better long-term policies. Pension reforms must continue. 5/6

The increasing share of people aged 65 or over means that more public spending on pensions, healthcare and long-term care will be needed. This will make it challenging for euro area countries to reduce their public debt and ensure fiscal sustainability. 4/6 https://t.co/QDSw8s8M1V

Population ageing will lead to fewer people working in the euro area over time, as there will be fewer young workers entering the workforce and older workers tend to work less. Ageing may also have an adverse effect on productivity growth. 3/6 https://t.co/oHecTwUsk5

The share of people aged 65 or older will continue to increase in the euro area, mostly due to higher life expectancy and a low fertility rate. Migration will only partially mitigate this. 2/6 https://t.co/loAy2jkZyE

(THREAD) Population ageing in the euro area is set to continue and even intensify over the next few decades. How does this affect our economy? Read this thread summarising our latest Economic Bulletin article on the subject. [Full article: https://t.co/UggEZjCwk0] 1/6 https://t.co/2lUbv7stTp

The ECB supports euro area banks in tackling bad loans, i.e. loans that aren’t being repaid or are unlikely to be repaid. Reducing bad loans will benefit businesses, investors and consumers. Here’s how https://t.co/fWPffJKFbm

Tackling non-performing loans in Europe is a joint effort. In addition to what supervisors do in this area, work is needed on the legal front and secondary markets need to be developed https://t.co/IyGRFk0gLg

The percentage of loans that are non-performing in the euro area is decreasing, however more work is needed to tackle bad loans and to prevent them from piling up in the future https://t.co/aMkvBfUzDt
Today we publish an addendum to our guidance on non-performing loans. For the ECB as a supervisor bad loans are a top priority. Here is what we have done on this front https://t.co/IyGRFk0gLg

Cœuré: Ohne weitere Reformen könnte die EZB in der nächsten Krise gezwungen sein, die Grenzen unseres Mandats zu testen
Cœuré: Wir brauchen ein ausgewogenes Gleichgewicht zwischen Solidarität und Verantwortung
Rede Benoît Cœuré: Unsere Währungsunion stärken und festigen https://t.co/AUXwiWEVJi
Cœuré: Without further reforms the next crisis may force the ECB to test the limits of its mandate
Cœuré: We should strike the right balance between solidarity and responsibility
Cœuré: Economic fragmentation is receding on our continent. Political fragmentation should not jeopardize these achievements
Speech Benoît Cœuré: Making our monetary union stronger and more resilient https://t.co/34nkZSM0t2

Constâncio: The European legal macroprudential policy framework needs to be enhanced by introducing new instruments, including for non-banks, and by allowing Member States and the ECB more flexibility to activate those instruments.
Constâncio: Apart from a few pockets of vulnerability, the overall financial stability picture in the euro area reveals no signs of generalised asset market bubbles. https://t.co/zI4eieTixw
